sub_topic: Calculation of magnetic field due to a current-carrying inductor
message_1: A current of 5 A flows through an inductor of 0.02 H. Determine the magnetic field at a distance of 10 cm from the center of the inductor.
message_2:
To determine the magnetic field at a distance of 10 cm from the center of the inductor, we will use the formula for the magnetic field around a long straight wire carrying current:

B = (μ₀ * I) / (2 * π * r)

where B is the magnetic field, μ₀ is the permeability of free space (4π × 10^(-7) Tm/A), I is the current (5 A), and r is the distance from the center of the inductor (10 cm = 0.1 m).

B = (4π × 10^(-7) Tm/A * 5 A) / (2 * π * 0.1 m)

B = (20π × 10^(-7) Tm) / (0.2π m)

B = 10 × 10^(-7) T

B = 10^(-6) T

The magnetic field at a distance of 10 cm from the center of the inductor is 1 μT (microtesla).
